title: Welcome To My Blog
text: Greetings all! My blog will be covering some background about me along with an exciting topic where I apply my knowledge!

title: Linear Regression
text:
I will be reviewing the code, reasoning, and outcomes of a linear regression problem from a class lab assignment I completed.


'data.frame':   999 obs. of  12 variables:
 $ fage    : int  NA NA 19 21 NA NA 18 17 NA 20 ...
 $ mage    : int  13 14 15 15 15 15 15 15 16 16 ...
 $ mature  : chr  "younger mom" "younger mom" "younger mom" "younger mom" ...
 $ weeks   : int  39 42 37 41 39 38 37 35 38 37 ...
 $ premie  : chr  "full term" "full term" "full term" "full term" ...
 $ visits  : int  10 15 11 6 9 19 12 5 9 13 ...
 $ marital : chr  "married" "married" "married" "married" ...
 $ gained  : int  38 20 38 34 27 22 76 15 NA 52 ...
 $ weight  : num  7.63 7.88 6.63 8 6.38 5.38 8.44 4.69 8.81 6.94 ...
 $ gender  : chr  "male" "male" "female" "male" ...
 $ habit   : chr  "nonsmoker" "nonsmoker" "nonsmoker" "nonsmoker" ...
 $ whitemom: chr  "not white" "not white" "white" "white" ...





Here is a rundown of my process:

In this lab assignment I started off by loading all the libraries I would need.
I then inputted a code to read the data on hand before getting rid of the lowbirthweight.
After, I ensured that all numeric and factor variables were properly coded as so.
I went on to recognize any absent values and used a code to utilize median amounts in place of absent numeric variables and mode amounts in place of absent categorical variables.
Then, I had to decide which of the variables had the greatest connection, keeping absolute value in mind, to our target variable. To better display this interaction between the variables, I made use of a scatterplot and included a linear regression line.
What does the outcome mean?
The scatterplot and linear regression line showcased that with the variables, weeks and weight, there appears to be a positive correlation between the two. To sum it up, as the weeks in which the pregnancy lasted increased, the babyâ€™s weight in pounds when delivered also increased.

title: Amar Saleh
text:
Hello everyone! My name is Amar Saleh and I am working towards completing an Advanced Data Analytics MS from UNT. My undergraduate years were spent at UTA where I graduated with a Finance BBA in 2021. My love for analyzing numbers is what inspired me to pursue a finance degree. Upon graduation I became more fascinated with the technology field and was motivated to find a way to intertwine my love for analytics with the tech world- data analytics was my answer! I work as an auditor for a cable company where I help ensure all data collected about the boxes is correct along with confirming all necessary boxes are accounted for.
Experience in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, RStudio, Python, Linux, SAS
